        <div class="Index-page-content ">
          <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page" data-updated-on="1567135768545" id="page-5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb"><div class="row sqs-row"><div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12"><div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" id="block-c2dc0b66ff706542d4a2"><div class="sqs-block-content"><h1 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">In Support of Joi Ito</h1><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">This is a time for reflection, not only at the Media Lab but also within the broader MIT community. Now is a time to revisit how the principles of an organization are expressed through its funding process—and to explore how we can, together, build mechanisms to ensure our fundraising efforts reflect our core values.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">However, the conversation has veered into increasingly pessimistic territory, and the media has focused their attention largely on this negativity. As such, it is our responsibility as members of the greater Media Lab community to add our voice to the conversation. We have experienced first-hand Joi’s integrity, and stand in testament to his overwhelmingly positive influence on our lives—and sincerely hope he remains our visionary director for many years to come. </p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">We greatly admire the courage behind Joi’s public apology for his connections to Epstein, and his commitment to financial restitution. There are numerous victims of Epstein’s crimes, and we acknowledge their trauma and fully support their right to justice. We hope their bravery to speak out continues to change our culture for the better and compel us to question the systems that both actively and passively abetted their abuse.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">At MIT, we pride ourselves on our ability to rise above complex challenges and, with openness and rationality, improve ourselves and the world around us. What better exemplar of this than Joi, who, with no college degree, has revitalized, reinvigorated, and re-engergized the founding spirit of the Media Lab, expanded the scope of MIT’s research, democratized access to the Media Lab’s resources, and changed our perception of what it means to be educated. Joi is always enthusiastic, energetic, and supportive—and it is difficult to overstate the influence he has had on the Media Lab and its efforts to mobilize global-scale resources to combat systemic injustices.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">The change that is needed must be inclusive, evidence-based, and constructive, and the work towards this should start immediately under Joi’s direction. To this end, we the undersigned, attest not only to Joi’s talent in managing one of the most complex and multidisciplinary research organizations in the world, but also, and more importantly, to his character: thoughtful, humble, principled, and generous. </p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">Joi, at a time when you are offering apologies and support to us, we want to answer back: We are here for you, we support you, we will forever be grateful for your impact on our lives—and we look forward to many more years of debate, growth, and learning. <strong>Please do not step aside.</strong></p></div></div><div class="sqs-block form-block sqs-block-form" data-block-type="9" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1566673185586_4352"><div class="sqs-block-content">

              <section id="in-support-of-joi-ito" class="Index-page" data-collection-id="5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb" data-parallax-id="5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb" data-edit-main-image="Background">
        
          <div class="Index-page-scroll-indicator hidden" data-controller="ScrollIndicator">
            <div class="Index-page-scroll-indicator-text">Scroll</div>
            <svg class="Index-page-scroll-indicator-arrow Icon Icon--caretLarge--down" viewbox="0 0 48 23">
              <use xlink:href="/assets/ui-icons.svg#caret-down-large-icon"></use>
            </svg>

        <div class="Index-page-content ">
          <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page" data-updated-on="1567135768545" id="page-5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb"><div class="row sqs-row"><div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12"><div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" id="block-c2dc0b66ff706542d4a2"><div class="sqs-block-content"><h1 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">In Support of Joi Ito</h1><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">This is a time for reflection, not only at the Media Lab but also within the broader MIT community. Now is a time to revisit how the principles of an organization are expressed through its funding process—and to explore how we can, together, build mechanisms to ensure our fundraising efforts reflect our core values.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">However, the conversation has veered into increasingly pessimistic territory, and the media has focused their attention largely on this negativity. As such, it is our responsibility as members of the greater Media Lab community to add our voice to the conversation. We have experienced first-hand Joi’s integrity, and stand in testament to his overwhelmingly positive influence on our lives—and sincerely hope he remains our visionary director for many years to come. </p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">We greatly admire the courage behind Joi’s public apology for his connections to Epstein, and his commitment to financial restitution. There are numerous victims of Epstein’s crimes, and we acknowledge their trauma and fully support their right to justice. We hope their bravery to speak out continues to change our culture for the better and compel us to question the systems that both actively and passively abetted their abuse.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">At MIT, we pride ourselves on our ability to rise above complex challenges and, with openness and rationality, improve ourselves and the world around us. What better exemplar of this than Joi, who, with no college degree, has revitalized, reinvigorated, and re-engergized the founding spirit of the Media Lab, expanded the scope of MIT’s research, democratized access to the Media Lab’s resources, and changed our perception of what it means to be educated. Joi is always enthusiastic, energetic, and supportive—and it is difficult to overstate the influence he has had on the Media Lab and its efforts to mobilize global-scale resources to combat systemic injustices.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">The change that is needed must be inclusive, evidence-based, and constructive, and the work towards this should start immediately under Joi’s direction. To this end, we the undersigned, attest not only to Joi’s talent in managing one of the most complex and multidisciplinary research organizations in the world, but also, and more importantly, to his character: thoughtful, humble, principled, and generous. </p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">Joi, at a time when you are offering apologies and support to us, we want to answer back: We are here for you, we support you, we will forever be grateful for your impact on our lives—and we look forward to many more years of debate, growth, and learning. <strong>Please do not step aside.</strong></p></div></div><div class="sqs-block form-block sqs-block-form" data-block-type="9" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1566673185586_4352"><div class="sqs-block-content">

              <section id="in-support-of-joi-ito" class="Index-page" data-collection-id="5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb" data-parallax-id="5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb" data-edit-main-image="Background">
        
          <div class="Index-page-scroll-indicator hidden" data-controller="ScrollIndicator">

            <svg class="Index-page-scroll-indicator-arrow Icon Icon--caretLarge--down" viewbox="0 0 48 23">

          <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page" data-updated-on="1567135768545" id="page-5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb"><div class="row sqs-row"><div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12"><div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" id="block-c2dc0b66ff706542d4a2"><div class="sqs-block-content"><h1 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">In Support of Joi Ito</h1><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">This is a time for reflection, not only at the Media Lab but also within the broader MIT community. Now is a time to revisit how the principles of an organization are expressed through its funding process—and to explore how we can, together, build mechanisms to ensure our fundraising efforts reflect our core values.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">However, the conversation has veered into increasingly pessimistic territory, and the media has focused their attention largely on this negativity. As such, it is our responsibility as members of the greater Media Lab community to add our voice to the conversation. We have experienced first-hand Joi’s integrity, and stand in testament to his overwhelmingly positive influence on our lives—and sincerely hope he remains our visionary director for many years to come. </p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">We greatly admire the courage behind Joi’s public apology for his connections to Epstein, and his commitment to financial restitution. There are numerous victims of Epstein’s crimes, and we acknowledge their trauma and fully support their right to justice. We hope their bravery to speak out continues to change our culture for the better and compel us to question the systems that both actively and passively abetted their abuse.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">At MIT, we pride ourselves on our ability to rise above complex challenges and, with openness and rationality, improve ourselves and the world around us. What better exemplar of this than Joi, who, with no college degree, has revitalized, reinvigorated, and re-engergized the founding spirit of the Media Lab, expanded the scope of MIT’s research, democratized access to the Media Lab’s resources, and changed our perception of what it means to be educated. Joi is always enthusiastic, energetic, and supportive—and it is difficult to overstate the influence he has had on the Media Lab and its efforts to mobilize global-scale resources to combat systemic injustices.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">The change that is needed must be inclusive, evidence-based, and constructive, and the work towards this should start immediately under Joi’s direction. To this end, we the undersigned, attest not only to Joi’s talent in managing one of the most complex and multidisciplinary research organizations in the world, but also, and more importantly, to his character: thoughtful, humble, principled, and generous. </p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">Joi, at a time when you are offering apologies and support to us, we want to answer back: We are here for you, we support you, we will forever be grateful for your impact on our lives—and we look forward to many more years of debate, growth, and learning. <strong>Please do not step aside.</strong></p></div></div><div class="sqs-block form-block sqs-block-form" data-block-type="9" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1566673185586_4352"><div class="sqs-block-content">

          <main class="Index" data-collection-id="58d01506e3df284bada16b9f" data-controller="IndexFirstSectionHeight, Parallax, IndexNavigation">
            
              <section id="in-support-of-joi-ito" class="Index-page" data-collection-id="5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb" data-parallax-id="5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb" data-edit-main-image="Background">
        
          <div class="Index-page-scroll-indicator hidden" data-controller="ScrollIndicator">
            <div class="Index-page-scroll-indicator-text">Scroll</div>
            <svg class="Index-page-scroll-indicator-arrow Icon Icon--caretLarge--down" viewbox="0 0 48 23">

        <div class="Index-page-content ">
          <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page" data-updated-on="1567867279150" id="page-5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb"><div class="row sqs-row"><div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12"><div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" id="block-c2dc0b66ff706542d4a2"><div class="sqs-block-content"><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;"><em>This petition was drafted by students on August 26th, 2019, and signed by members of the broader Media Lab community in the days that followed, to show their support for Joi and his apology. Given when community members added their names to this petition, their signatures should not be read as continued support of Joi staying on as Media Lab Director following the most recent revelations in the </em><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190907154537/https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/how-an-elite-university-research-center-concealed-its-relationship-with-jeffrey-epstein"><em>September 6th New Yorker article by Ronan Farrow</em></a><em>.</em></p><h1 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">In Support of Joi Ito</h1><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">This is a time for reflection, not only at the Media Lab but also within the broader MIT community. Now is a time to revisit how the principles of an organization are expressed through its funding process—and to explore how we can, together, build mechanisms to ensure our fundraising efforts reflect our core values.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">However, the conversation has veered into increasingly pessimistic territory, and the media has focused their attention largely on this negativity. As such, it is our responsibility as members of the greater Media Lab community to add our voice to the conversation. We have experienced first-hand Joi’s integrity, and stand in testament to his overwhelmingly positive influence on our lives—and sincerely hope he remains our visionary director for many years to come. </p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">We greatly admire the courage behind Joi’s public apology for his connections to Epstein, and his commitment to financial restitution. There are numerous victims of Epstein’s crimes, and we acknowledge their trauma and fully support their right to justice. We hope their bravery to speak out continues to change our culture for the better and compel us to question the systems that both actively and passively abetted their abuse.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">At MIT, we pride ourselves on our ability to rise above complex challenges and, with openness and rationality, improve ourselves and the world around us. What better exemplar of this than Joi, who, with no college degree, has revitalized, reinvigorated, and re-engergized the founding spirit of the Media Lab, expanded the scope of MIT’s research, democratized access to the Media Lab’s resources, and changed our perception of what it means to be educated. Joi is always enthusiastic, energetic, and supportive—and it is difficult to overstate the influence he has had on the Media Lab and its efforts to mobilize global-scale resources to combat systemic injustices.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">The change that is needed must be inclusive, evidence-based, and constructive, and the work towards this should start immediately under Joi’s direction. To this end, we the undersigned, attest not only to Joi’s talent in managing one of the most complex and multidisciplinary research organizations in the world, but also, and more importantly, to his character: thoughtful, humble, principled, and generous. </p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">Joi, at a time when you are offering apologies and support to us, we want to answer back: We are here for you, we support you, we will forever be grateful for your impact on our lives—and we look forward to many more years of debate, growth, and learning. <strong>Please do not step aside.</strong></p></div></div><div class="sqs-block form-block sqs-block-form" data-block-type="9" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1566673185586_4352"><div class="sqs-block-content">

              <section id="in-support-of-joi-ito" class="Index-page" data-collection-id="5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb" data-parallax-id="5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb" data-edit-main-image="Background">
        
          <div class="Index-page-scroll-indicator hidden" data-controller="ScrollIndicator">
            <div class="Index-page-scroll-indicator-text">Scroll</div>
            <svg class="Index-page-scroll-indicator-arrow Icon Icon--caretLarge--down" viewbox="0 0 48 23">

        <div class="Index-page-content ">
          <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page" data-updated-on="1567867279150" id="page-5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb"><div class="row sqs-row"><div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12"><div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" id="block-c2dc0b66ff706542d4a2"><div class="sqs-block-content"><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;"><em>This petition was drafted by students on August 26th, 2019, and signed by members of the broader Media Lab community in the days that followed, to show their support for Joi and his apology. Given when community members added their names to this petition, their signatures should not be read as continued support of Joi staying on as Media Lab Director following the most recent revelations in the </em><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190907165800/https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/how-an-elite-university-research-center-concealed-its-relationship-with-jeffrey-epstein"><em>September 6th New Yorker article by Ronan Farrow</em></a><em>.</em></p><h1 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">In Support of Joi Ito</h1><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">This is a time for reflection, not only at the Media Lab but also within the broader MIT community. Now is a time to revisit how the principles of an organization are expressed through its funding process—and to explore how we can, together, build mechanisms to ensure our fundraising efforts reflect our core values.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">However, the conversation has veered into increasingly pessimistic territory, and the media has focused their attention largely on this negativity. As such, it is our responsibility as members of the greater Media Lab community to add our voice to the conversation. We have experienced first-hand Joi’s integrity, and stand in testament to his overwhelmingly positive influence on our lives—and sincerely hope he remains our visionary director for many years to come. </p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">We greatly admire the courage behind Joi’s public apology for his connections to Epstein, and his commitment to financial restitution. There are numerous victims of Epstein’s crimes, and we acknowledge their trauma and fully support their right to justice. We hope their bravery to speak out continues to change our culture for the better and compel us to question the systems that both actively and passively abetted their abuse.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">At MIT, we pride ourselves on our ability to rise above complex challenges and, with openness and rationality, improve ourselves and the world around us. What better exemplar of this than Joi, who, with no college degree, has revitalized, reinvigorated, and re-engergized the founding spirit of the Media Lab, expanded the scope of MIT’s research, democratized access to the Media Lab’s resources, and changed our perception of what it means to be educated. Joi is always enthusiastic, energetic, and supportive—and it is difficult to overstate the influence he has had on the Media Lab and its efforts to mobilize global-scale resources to combat systemic injustices.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">The change that is needed must be inclusive, evidence-based, and constructive, and the work towards this should start immediately under Joi’s direction. To this end, we the undersigned, attest not only to Joi’s talent in managing one of the most complex and multidisciplinary research organizations in the world, but also, and more importantly, to his character: thoughtful, humble, principled, and generous. </p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">Joi, at a time when you are offering apologies and support to us, we want to answer back: We are here for you, we support you, we will forever be grateful for your impact on our lives—and we look forward to many more years of debate, growth, and learning. <strong>Please do not step aside.</strong></p></div></div><div class="sqs-block form-block sqs-block-form" data-block-type="9" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1566673185586_4352"><div class="sqs-block-content">

              <section id="in-support-of-joi-ito" class="Index-page" data-collection-id="5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb" data-parallax-id="5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb" data-edit-main-image="Background">
        
          <div class="Index-page-scroll-indicator hidden" data-controller="ScrollIndicator">
            <div class="Index-page-scroll-indicator-text">Scroll</div>
            <svg class="Index-page-scroll-indicator-arrow Icon Icon--caretLarge--down" viewbox="0 0 48 23">

        <div class="Index-page-content ">
          <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page" data-updated-on="1567867279150" id="page-5d618666b4c49b0001421ceb"><div class="row sqs-row"><div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12"><div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" id="block-c2dc0b66ff706542d4a2"><div class="sqs-block-content"><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;"><em>This petition was drafted by students on August 26th, 2019, and signed by members of the broader Media Lab community in the days that followed, to show their support for Joi and his apology. Given when community members added their names to this petition, their signatures should not be read as continued support of Joi staying on as Media Lab Director following the most recent revelations in the </em><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190907173502/https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/how-an-elite-university-research-center-concealed-its-relationship-with-jeffrey-epstein"><em>September 6th New Yorker article by Ronan Farrow</em></a><em>.</em></p><h1 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">In Support of Joi Ito</h1><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">This is a time for reflection, not only at the Media Lab but also within the broader MIT community. Now is a time to revisit how the principles of an organization are expressed through its funding process—and to explore how we can, together, build mechanisms to ensure our fundraising efforts reflect our core values.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">However, the conversation has veered into increasingly pessimistic territory, and the media has focused their attention largely on this negativity. As such, it is our responsibility as members of the greater Media Lab community to add our voice to the conversation. We have experienced first-hand Joi’s integrity, and stand in testament to his overwhelmingly positive influence on our lives—and sincerely hope he remains our visionary director for many years to come. </p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">We greatly admire the courage behind Joi’s public apology for his connections to Epstein, and his commitment to financial restitution. There are numerous victims of Epstein’s crimes, and we acknowledge their trauma and fully support their right to justice. We hope their bravery to speak out continues to change our culture for the better and compel us to question the systems that both actively and passively abetted their abuse.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">At MIT, we pride ourselves on our ability to rise above complex challenges and, with openness and rationality, improve ourselves and the world around us. What better exemplar of this than Joi, who, with no college degree, has revitalized, reinvigorated, and re-engergized the founding spirit of the Media Lab, expanded the scope of MIT’s research, democratized access to the Media Lab’s resources, and changed our perception of what it means to be educated. Joi is always enthusiastic, energetic, and supportive—and it is difficult to overstate the influence he has had on the Media Lab and its efforts to mobilize global-scale resources to combat systemic injustices.</p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">The change that is needed must be inclusive, evidence-based, and constructive, and the work towards this should start immediately under Joi’s direction. To this end, we the undersigned, attest not only to Joi’s talent in managing one of the most complex and multidisciplinary research organizations in the world, but also, and more importantly, to his character: thoughtful, humble, principled, and generous. </p><p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">Joi, at a time when you are offering apologies and support to us, we want to answer back: We are here for you, we support you, we will forever be grateful for your impact on our lives—and we look forward to many more years of debate, growth, and learning. <strong>Please do not step aside.</strong></p></div></div><div class="sqs-block form-block sqs-block-form" data-block-type="9" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1566673185586_4352"><div class="sqs-block-content">
